info.title: NetSuite REST Record API
info.description: NetSuite REST Record API generated 2024-05-24 at 12:33:28 UTC for account TSTDRV1303059, user joe.klug@peregrineconnect.com with role Neuron ESB Integration.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: The server behavior requested by the client. Use 'respond-async' to execute the request asynchronously. If the request is executed asynchronously, 'Preference-applied: respond-async' is returned in the response.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: A user-defined unique idempotency key that is applied to every asynchronous requests to ensure that the request is executed only once. Only one request can be executed with every unique idempotency key. Use UUID in string format as defined by RFC 4122. If the request is executed synchronously, this value is ignored.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The search query that is used to filter results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit used to specify the number of results on a single page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset used for selecting a specific page of results.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: The server behavior requested by the client. Use 'respond-async' to execute the request asynchronously. If the request is executed asynchronously, 'Preference-applied: respond-async' is returned in the response.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: A user-defined unique idempotency key that is applied to every asynchronous requests to ensure that the request is executed only once. Only one request can be executed with every unique idempotency key. Use UUID in string format as defined by RFC 4122. If the request is executed synchronously, this value is ignored.

parameters.name: replace
parameters.description: The names of sublists on this record. All sublist lines will be replaced with lines specified in the request. The names are delimited by comma.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-PropertyNameValidation
parameters.description: Sets the strictness of property name validation.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-PropertyValueValidation
parameters.description: Sets the strictness of property value validation.

X-NetSuite-PropertyValidation.description: The description of a property validation failure.

X-NetSuite-Warning.description: Warning messages that occurred during processing.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Internal identifier.

parameters.name: expandSubResources
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to automatically expand all sublists, sublist lines, and subrecords on this record.

parameters.name: simpleEnumFormat
parameters.description: Set to true to return enumeration values in a format that only shows the internal ID value.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The names of the fields and sublists on the record. Only the selected fields and sublists will be returned in the response.

X-NetSuite-Warning.description: Warning messages that occurred during processing.

parameters.name: replaceSelectedFields
parameters.description: If set to 'true', all fields that should be deleted in the update request, including body fields, must be included in the 'replace' query parameter.

type.title: Type
type.description: A URI reference to the documentation about the problem type.

title.title: Title
title.description: A human-readable description of the problem type.

status.title: Status
status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the server the request originates from.

o:errorDetails.description: An array containing one or more problem types.

detail.title: Detail
detail.description: A detailed, human-readable description of the problem occurrence.

o:errorPath.title: Error Path
o:errorPath.description: The JSON path that indicates where the problem occurs within the request body.

o:errorUrl.title: Error URL
o:errorUrl.description: The URI of the first element in the request URL where the problem occurs.

o:errorHeader.title: Error Header
o:errorHeader.description: The name of the HTTP header where the problem occurs.

o:errorQueryParam.title: Error Query Parameter
o:errorQueryParam.description: The name of the query parameter where the problem occurs.

o:errorCode.title: Error Code
o:errorCode.description: The application-specific error code. Similar problem types are grouped together.

emailTransactions.title: Email Transactions
emailTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default. * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted. Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use. There are also preferences to set default values for new customer records at Setup > Company > Preferences > Printing, Fax,& Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Customers Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions. You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to Lists > Mass Updates > Mass Updates > General and click Customer.

startDate.title: Start Date
startDate.description: Enter the date this person or company became a customer, lead or prospect. If this person or company has a contract with you, enter the start date of the contract. If you enter an estimate or an opportunity for this customer, this field will be updated with the date of that transaction.

lastSaleDate.title: Last Sales Date
lastSaleDate.description: Returns the date of the last sale to the customer.

password.title: Password
password.description: Assign a password to give this customer access to NetSuite. The Password Criteria fields will ensure that you create a password that meets the password policy in effect in your account. You will need to tell the user the password you assign. For more information, see the help topic NetSuite Password Requirements.

balance.title: Balance
balance.description: The customer's current accounts receivable balance due appears here. If you use the Multiple Currencies feature, the amount in this field is shown in the customer's currency.

printOnCheckAs.title: Print on Check As
printOnCheckAs.description: What you enter here prints on the Pay to the Order of line of a check instead of what you entered in the Customer field.

id.title: Internal ID
id.description: The internal ID for this record is shown here. If you do not want to show internal IDs, clear the Show Internal IDs box at Home > Set Preferences.

fax.title: Fax
fax.description: Enter a fax number for this record. You should enter the fax number exactly as it must be dialed. If a '1' is required to fax to this number, be sure to include it at the beginning of the number. The number you enter automatically appears in the To Be Faxed field of transactions when you select this customer. To fax NetSuite forms, an administrator must first set up fax service at Setup > Set Up Printing, Fax and E-mail > Fax.

thirdPartyZipCode.title: 3rd Party Billing Zip
thirdPartyZipCode.description: Enter the zip code associated with the customer’s UPS or FedEx account number.

dateCreated.title: Date Created
dateCreated.description: In this field, NetSuite automatically records the date you created this record.

overdueBalance.title: Overdue
overdueBalance.description: The Overdue field shows the total amount owed for open transactions that are past their due date based on the invoice terms. Note: For open transactions that do not have a due date, the transaction date is used as the due date to calculate this total. If you use the Multiple Currencies feature, the amount in this field is shown in the customer's currency.

lastName.title: Last Name
lastName.description: Optionally enter a last name here.

firstVisit.title: First Visit
firstVisit.description: This is the date this customer first viewed your Web site.

endDate.title: End Date
endDate.description: If you have a contract with this customer, enter the end date here. If you are entering a job record, enter the projected end date of the job here.

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: Enter a phone number for your customer. It will appear on the Customer List report.

phoneticName.title: Furigana
phoneticName.description: Enter the furigana character you want to use to sort this record.

companyName.title: Company Name
companyName.description: Enter the legal name of the customer. If you use Auto-Generated Numbering, it is important that you enter the customer's name here, as the Customer Name field fills with the number or code for this record.

custentity_sii_id.title: ID Number in the country of residence

defaultAddress.title: Default Address
defaultAddress.description: This field automatically shows the default billing address that you enter and add using the Address subtab.

openingBalance.title: Opening Balance
openingBalance.description: Enter the opening balance of this customer's account.

lastVisit.title: Last Visit
lastVisit.description: This is the date this customer most recently visited your Web site.

isPerson.title: Is Individual
isPerson.description: Choose the type of customer record you are creating by selecting Company or Individual in the Type field. This selection determines which fields and subtabs are used on this record.

password2.title: Confirm Password
password2.description: Reenter the password in this field to verify that you entered the same password twice.

email.title: Email
email.description: Enter your customer's email address. If you allow your customers to access their accounts online, this becomes part of their access codes.

openingBalanceDate.title: Opening Balance Date
openingBalanceDate.description: Enter the date of the balance entered in the Opening Balance field.

depositBalance.title: Deposit Balance
depositBalance.description: The Customer Deposit Balance field displays the total amount of unapplied deposits for the customer. Deposits are recorded in the general ledger, as a liability, when the customer makes an advance payment before delivery of goods or services. A deposit balance exists until the goods or services are delivered. Deposits do not affect the customer's accounts receivable balance. If you use the Multiple Currencies feature, the amount in this field is shown in the customer's currency.

lastOrderDate.title: Last Sales Order Date
lastOrderDate.description: Returns the date of the last order from the customer.

lastPageVisited.title: Last Page Visited
lastPageVisited.description: This field displays the last page this customer viewed on his or her most recent visit to your Web site.

url.title: URL
url.description: Enter the URL associated with this customer.

firstSaleDate.title: First Sale Date
firstSaleDate.description: Returns the date of the first sale to the customer.

autoName.title: Auto
autoName.description: Clear this box to manually enter a name for this record. If you leave this box marked, NetSuite assigns a name or number for this record based on your settings at Setup > Set Up Auto-Generated Numbers.

shipComplete.title: Ship Complete
shipComplete.description: Check this box if you only want to ship orders to this customer when they are completely fulfilled.

keywords.title: Search Engine Keywords (1st Visit)
keywords.description: If this customer was referred to your Web site by a search engine on the first visit, this field lists the keywords the customer used with the search engine.

externalId.title: External ID
externalId.description: Returns the customer's external ID, if one is assigned.

entityId.title: Entity ID
entityId.description: Enter the name of this customer, prospect or lead the way it should appear in all lists and on the Pay to the Order of line of checks. If you use Auto-Generated Numbering, the customer number or code fills here. Enter the customer name in the Company Name field.

isAutogeneratedRepresentingEntity.title: Is Autogenerated Representing Entity
isAutogeneratedRepresentingEntity.description: This field indicates that this entity was automatically generated by NetSuite to represent a specific subsidiary.

isBudgetApproved.title: Budget Approved
isBudgetApproved.description: Check this box if the customer's budget has been approved.

mobilePhone.title: Mobile Phone
mobilePhone.description: Enter a mobile or cell phone number for this person.

unbilledOrders.title: Unbilled Orders
unbilledOrders.description: This field displays the total amount of orders that have been entered but not yet billed. If you have enabled the preference Customer Credit Limit Includes Orders, then this total is included in credit limit calculations. Set this preference at Setup > Accounting > Preferences > Accounting Preferences > General. If you use the Multiple Currencies feature, the amount in this field is shown in the customer's currency.

searchStage.title: Stage
searchStage.description: Returns the stage of the customer record, such as Customer or Lead.

altPhone.title: Alt. Phone
altPhone.description: If applicable, enter an alternate phone number for this record.

firstOrderDate.title: First Sales Order Date
firstOrderDate.description: Returns the date of the first order from the customer.

faxTransactions.title: Fax Transactions
faxTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default. * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted. Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use. There are also preferences to set default values for new customer records at Setup > Company > Preferences > Printing, Fax,& Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Customers Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions. You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to Lists > Mass Updates > Mass Updates > General and click Customer.

clickStream.title: Click-Stream (1st Visit)
clickStream.description: This field lists the pages this customer visited on his or her first visit to your Web site in chronological order.

resaleNumber.title: Resale Number
resaleNumber.description: If you do not collect sales tax from this customer because your merchandise will be resold, enter your customer's valid tax license number here. Make sure that you also set the Not Taxable tax code for this customer.

altEmail.title: Alt. Email
altEmail.description: Enter an alternate email address for this customer. If you use the Capture Email Replies, email sent with the alternate email address are automatically attached to the customer record.

defaultOrderPriority.title: Default Order Priority
defaultOrderPriority.description: Enter a number to designate the priority for this customer.

salutation.title: Mr./Ms...
salutation.description: Enter the title of this person, such as Mr., Mrs., Ms., Dr., Rev., etc.

isInactive.title: Inactive
isInactive.description: When you check this box, this customer will no longer appear on customer, prospect or lead list unless you check the Show Inactives box at the bottom of the list page. This customer's name will also no longer appear in other dropdown lists containing customers, and the customer will no longer have access to NetSuite or be able to sign into your Web store.

thirdPartyAcct.title: 3rd Party Billing Account Number
thirdPartyAcct.description: Enter this customer’s FedEx® or UPS® account number in the 3rd Party Billing Account Number field. This account number is used if you select Consignee Billing on item fulfillments using UPS or select Bill Recipient on item fulfillments using FedEx.

homePhone.title: Home Phone
homePhone.description: Enter a home phone number for this person.

estimatedBudget.title: Estimated Budget
estimatedBudget.description: Enter the estimated budget the prospect or customer has for this opportunity.

title.title: Job Title
title.description: Enter the job title for this person's position at his or her company.

defaultShippingAddress.title: Default Shipping Address
defaultShippingAddress.description: Returns the customer's default shipping address, if one is entered on the customer record.

giveAccess.title: Login Access
giveAccess.description: Check this box to give your customer access to NetSuite. The Customer Center role gives a customer access to view estimates, orders, invoices and payments.

visits.title: Number of Visits
visits.description: This field displays the total number of visits this customer has made to your Web site. A new visit is counted after the customer leaves your site and returns.

comments.title: Comments
comments.description: Enter any other information you wish to track for this customer.

accountNumber.title: Account
accountNumber.description: If you assign accounts to your customers, enter an account number for this customer here.

reminderDays.title: Reminder Days
reminderDays.description: Enter how many days before the end date you want to be reminded that this customer's contract or job service needs renewing. You can set the reminder to appear in the Reminders portlet on your Home, Lists and Transactions pages by clicking Customize Page on each page. On the Layout tab, click the Right Side Content subtab, and check the Reminders box. Then click the Reminders subtab, and check the Customers to Review box. Click Save.

lastModifiedDate.title: Last Modified Date
lastModifiedDate.description: Returns the date on which the customer record was last modified.

middleName.title: Middle Name
middleName.description: Returns the customer's middle name or initial, if one is entered on the customer record.

printTransactions.title: Print Transactions
printTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default. * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted. Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use. There are also preferences to set default values for new customer records at Setup > Company > Preferences > Printing, Fax,& Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Customers Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions. You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to Lists > Mass Updates > Mass Updates > General and click Customer.

referrer.title: Referrer (1st Visit)
referrer.description: This field diplays the URL for the site the customer used to first access your Web site. For example, if this customer clicked a link to your site from the results of a search engine, the URL is provided for the results of that search.

syncPartnerTeams.title: Update Transactions
syncPartnerTeams.description: Check this box if you want to update this customer's transactions to reflect the changes you make to the partner team.

daysOverdue.title: Days
daysOverdue.description: The number of days overdue this balance is overdue is shown here.

creditLimit.title: Credit Limit
creditLimit.description: Enter a credit limit to define the maximum currency amount the customer is allowed to accrue in outstanding receivables. When you meet or exceed this customer's limit while you are entering transactions, NetSuite can warn you or block the transaction. To set preferences for credit limit handling, an administrator must go to Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences > General > Customer Credit Limit Handling. For more information, click Help at the top of the page and search for Customer Credit Limits and Holds.

sendEmail.title: Send New Access Notification Email
sendEmail.description: Check this box to automatically send an email notifying this customer that you have them access to NetSuite. The standard NetSuite email message also contains a link to let the user create a password. If you do not check this box, you must check the Manually Assign or Change Password box. You must create the password, and tell the user the password, and when and how to log in. For security reasons, do not send the password by email.

items.title: Items
items.description: An array field that represents a collection of elements, for example, sublist lines, multiselect items, or search results.
